required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Supraglottic Airway Insertion on the Accuracy of Cricothyroid Membrane Identification in Females
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Supraglottic Airway Insertion on the Accuracy of Cricothyroid Membrane Identification in Females- a Prospective Observational Study.

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective, observational, study that will examine if a sited supraglottic airway (the igel) will increase the accuracy of identifying the cricothyroid membrane in female patients.
Consented patients that meet inclusion criteria are assessed by clinicians under general anaesthesia with and without a supraglottic airway in situ. The accuracy of CTM identification by palpation will be evaluated using ultrasound.

detailed_description.textblock:
Palpation of the airway structures results in misidentification of the cricothyroid membrane (CTM) in a high proportion of women. Female front of neck anatomy is less distinct compared to males with reduced angulation of the laryngeal cartilages making it harder to distinguish the relevant landmarks. In obese patients, overlying subcutaneous tissue compounds this problem and several studies have demonstrated poor success identifying the CTM by palpation in this population. Supraglottic airway device (SAD) insertion precedes emergency front of neck access attempts in the stepwise progression from failed intubation to cricothyroidotomy. The nature and clinical implication of SAD insertion on cricothyroidotomy remain unstudied.
Sixty four patients will undergo front of neck airway assessment by volunteer clinicians with and without a SAD in situ (control and SAD assessments, within-subjects design). The patients are fasting women presenting for routine gynaecological surgery. Eight anaesthetists, at different levels of training, will perform eight individual CTM assessments with and without the SAD in situ.
Ultrasound images will be captured in the sagittal plane immediately before and after supraglottic airway insertion. Images are then downloaded, anonymised and randomised for blinded digital analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: accurate identification of the cricothyroid membrane
primary_outcome.time_frame: At clinician assessment, on the day of patient recruitment.
primary_outcome.description: accuracy of cricothyroid membrane identification, measured as either successful identification or unsuccessful (binary outcome). A successful identification is within 5mm of the midline and within the upper and lower borders of the cricothyroid membrane as measured using ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accurate identification of the midline of the neck
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At clinician assessment, on the day of patient recruitment.
secondary_outcome.description: Accurate identification of the midline of the neck, binary outcome. A successful identification is within 5mm of the midline of the cricothyroid membrane as measured using ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At clinician assessment, on the day of patient recruitment.
secondary_outcome.description: Difficulty of assessing the cricothyroid membrane as graded subjectively by the clinician using a visual analogue scale (VAS) where '0' is the easiest possible assessment of the location of the cricothyroid membrane and '10' is the most difficult possible assessment of the location of the cricothyroid membrane.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time taken to attempt localisation of the cricothyroid membrane
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At clinician assessment, on the day of patient recruitment.
secondary_outcome.description: The time taken in seconds to attempt localisation of the cricothyroid membrane

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance from clinician assessment to actual cricothyroid membrane location
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On blinded, retrospective ultrasound analysis of images captured at the time of clinician assessment of the cricothyroid membrane. Blinded retrospective ultrasound assessment is to take place within 3 months of patient recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: The distance measured from the clinicians estimate of where the cricothyroid membrane is to where the actual location of the CTM is using ultrasound and measured in millimetres

secondary_outcome.measure: The distance from the skin to the first tracheal ring
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On blinded, retrospective ultrasound analysis of images captured at the time of clinician assessment of the cricothyroid membrane. Blinded retrospective ultrasound assessment is to take place within 3 months of patient recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: The distance from the skin to the superficial surface of the first tracheal ring measured in millimetres using digital analysis of ultrasound images

secondary_outcome.measure: The distance from the skin to the cricoid cartilage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On blinded, retrospective ultrasound analysis of images captured at the time of clinician assessment of the cricothyroid membrane. Blinded retrospective ultrasound assessment is to take place within 3 months of patient recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: The distance from the skin to the superficial surface of the first tracheal ring measured in millimetres using digital analysis of ultrasound images

secondary_outcome.measure: The angle between the surface tissue interface of the cricothyroid membrane and the trachea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On blinded, retrospective ultrasound analysis of images captured at the time of clinician assessment of the cricothyroid membrane. Blinded retrospective ultrasound assessment is to take place within 3 months of patient recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: The angle between the surface tissue interface of the cricothyroid membrane and the trachea measured in degrees using digital analysis of ultrasound images

arm_group.description: CTM assessed with supraglottic airway in situ and without

study_pop.textblock: women attending for routine gynaecological surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women attending for routine surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to give informed consent
- abnormal neck anatomy
- history of gastroesophageal reflux
- history of neck surgery or radiotherapy
- contraindication to supraglottic airway device insertion
